greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Primes of the form 43*n^2 - 537*n + 2971 in order of increasing nonnegative values of n.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime-Generating Polynomials
example: 1511 is in this sequence since 43*4^2 - 537*4 + 2971 = 688-2148+2971 = 1511 is prime.
program: (PARI) lista(nn) = for(n=0, nn, if(ispseudoprime(p=43*n^2 - 537*n + 2971), print1(p, ", "))); \\ _Altug Alkan_, Apr 24 2016
results.author: _Robert Price_, Apr 24 2016
